column4: can someone tell me the command to start and stop ssh server in ubuntu? i looked on google with no luck
ok i don't have to do net start sshd?
i don't have it
i thougth so i installed openssh
is it not included with that
so its /etc/init.d/openssh?
sorry i'm new to this trying to figure out how to launch my apps remotely for fun
file not found
hmm i just installed it from the repository :(
apt-get install openssh-server
are you on warty or hoary?
you must have an apt-get install or something somewhere that hasn't quit
look for dpkg, apt, dselect, aptitude, or even another instance of synaptic
that's fucked up.  for a fast reboot do a sudo shutdown -f now, then when you get the # just hit ctrl-d
you need openssh-server though
if it's saying "do you want to connect anyway", just say yes
I think y ou must know more about the actual use of ssh than I do because I have no idea what you're talking about =(
to use fsck I believe the filesystem needs to be mounted as read only
you need to fsck / ?
sudo `shutdown -F now' I believe
running warty?
oh, from what you had said before it sounded like you had automatic login enabled
have you installed flux?  last I knew it wasn't in warty
I think you're right - ~/.xsession
